abstract.text: An
object manages an OpenGL ES
—the state information, commands, and resources needed to draw using OpenGL ES. To execute OpenGL ES commands, you need a current rendering context.

inlineContent.text: Drawing resources, such as textures and renderbuffers, are managed for the
object associated with the context. When you initialize a new
object, you can choose to have it create a new sharegroup, or you can use one obtained from a previously created context.
Before drawing to a context, you must bind a complete framebuffer object to the context. For more information on configuring rendering contexts, see

abstract.text: Create 3D and 2D graphics effects with this compact, efficient subset of OpenGL.
An
object manages an OpenGL ES
—the state information, commands, and resources needed to draw using OpenGL ES. To execute OpenGL ES commands, you need a current rendering context.
The OpenGL ES rendering API version supported by the context. (read-only)
Returns the current rendering context for the calling thread.
A label describing the context for use in debugging.
Initializes and returns a newly allocated rendering context with the specified version of the OpenGL ES rendering API.
Initializes and returns a newly allocated rendering context with the specified version of OpenGL ES rendering API and the specified sharegroup.
A Boolean value that determines whether OpenGL ES defers work to another thread.
Displays a renderbuffer’s contents on screen.
Binds a drawable object’s storage to an OpenGL ES renderbuffer object.
Makes the specified context the current rendering context for the calling thread.
The context’s sharegroup object. (read-only)
Versions of OpenGL ES that a rendering context provides.
An
object manages OpenGL ES resources associated with one or more
objects. It is created when an
object is initialized and disposed of when the last
object that references it is released. As an opaque object, there is no developer accessible API.
The root class of most Objective-C class hierarchies, from which subclasses inherit a basic interface to the runtime system and the ability to behave as Objective-C objects.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.

inlineContent.text: OpenGLES API deprecated. (Define GLES_SILENCE_DEPRECATION to silence these warnings)
